title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
synopsis: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties, telling the story of Jay Gatsby's unrequited love for Daisy Buchanan.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
synopsis: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality, told through the eyes of young Scout Finch.

author: George Orwell
synopsis: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society under constant surveillance, led by Big Brother.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
synopsis: A classic novel about the manners and matrimonial machinations among the British gentry of the early 19th century.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
synopsis: The story of Holden Caulfield, a teenager who leaves his prep school in Pennsylvania and goes underground in New York City for three days.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
synopsis: A fantasy novel and children's book by J.R.R. Tolkien. It follows the quest of home-loving Bilbo Baggins to win a share of the treasure guarded by Smaug the dragon.

title: Fahrenheit 451
author: Ray Bradbury
synopsis: A dystopian novel about a future American society where books are outlawed and 'firemen' burn any that are found.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
synopsis: A novel about the experiences of the orphaned title character, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
synopsis: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic World State, where citizens are environmentally engineered into an intelligence-based social hierarchy.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
synopsis: A tale of passionate and doomed love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff, set on the Yorkshire moors.

title: The Odyssey
author: Homer
synopsis: An epic poem attributed to Homer, following the adventures of Odysseus as he tries to return home after the Trojan War.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
synopsis: A novel about the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod, commanded by Captain Ahab who leads his crew on a quest to find and kill the giant white sperm whale Moby Dick.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
synopsis: A historical novel that tells the story of five families during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
synopsis: A psychological drama of a young student Raskolnikov who murders an old pawnbroker woman and her sister, and then struggles with his conscience and the law.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
synopsis: A story about the spiritual drama of moral struggles concerning faith, doubt, and reason, set against a modernizing Russia.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
synopsis: A novel of complex human relationships set in the Russian society of the 19th century, focusing on the tragic love affair between Anna Karenina and Count Vronsky.

title: Madame Bovary
author: Gustave Flaubert
synopsis: A novel about the life of Emma Bovary, a doctor's wife, who has adulterous affairs and lives beyond her means in order to escape the banalities and emptiness of provincial life.

title: The Divine Comedy
author: Dante Alighieri
synopsis: An epic poem describing Dante's journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.

title: The Catch-22
author: Joseph Heller
synopsis: A satirical novel set during World War II, dealing with the absurdities of war and bureaucracy.

title: The Grapes of Wrath
author: John Steinbeck
synopsis: A novel about the Joad family, tenant farmers displaced from Oklahoma by the Great Depression, who set out for California along with thousands of others in search of a better life.
